meanings.definition: A person who has both extroverted and introverted qualities.
meanings.sent1: My friend is an ambivert, enjoying social gatherings but also needing time alone to recharge.
meanings.sent2: Being an ambivert, she can easily adapt to different social situations.
meanings.sent3: The ambivert at the party was the life of the gathering, yet also found solace in quiet moments.
meanings.sent4: She's like a chameleon, blending in with any group effortlessly - a true ambivert.
meanings.sent5: The ambivert's ability to navigate between social settings and solitude is truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: To have a balance of extroverted and introverted tendencies.
meanings.sent1: I try to ambivert my social interactions, finding a middle ground between being outgoing and reserved.
meanings.sent2: She ambiverts her energy, sometimes seeking company and other times enjoying her own company.
meanings.sent3: When she ambiverts her behavior, it confuses her friends who can't predict her mood.
meanings.sent4: His ability to ambivert his approach to work makes him a valuable team member.
meanings.sent5: Learning to ambivert your communication style can lead to better relationships with others.
